page.title: 08DUDDON ESTUARY
page.content: MILLOM IS ON THE ESTUARY OF THE RIVER DUDDON. IT IS ABOUT A MILE WIDE BEFORE IT REACHES THE SEA. FOOTPATHS ARE MARKED ACROSS THE SANDS AND YEARS AGO THERE WERE GUIDES TO TAKE YOU ACROSS AND IT WAS A MAIN ROUTE. NOWADAYS FEW PEOPLE CROSS THE SANDS. FISHERMEN GO OUT TO CATCH FLATFISH. THE TIDE COMES IN VERY FAST AND THERE ARE DEEP CHANNELS AND SINKING SANDS TO TRAP PEOPLE. THERE IS AN EMBANKMENT ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ESTUARY TO ACT AS A FLOOD BARRIER. SHEEP ARE GRAZED ON THE SALTINGS. BOTH THE ROAD AND THE RAILWAY HAVE TO GO A LONG WAY ROUND. IT IS ABOUT 20 MILES BY ROAD TO THE VILLAGE DIRECTLY OPPOSITE. THERE HAVE BEEN MANY PLANS TO BUILD A BRIDGE STRAIGHT ACROSS BUT THEY HAVE NEVER BEEN CARRIED OUT.
